result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Talvin F. Barrow

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:29 am cases 21CF651, 21CM342, 22CF98, 22CF252 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Talvin F. Barrow appeared by video.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Talvin F. Barrow.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for 11/14/22 at 2:00 pm (zoom available for defendant).
Ck# 44299 mailed to payer, cash bond modified
Notice of Pretrial Monitoring Program Termination
Plea hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with Z.M. or her residence.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

3:01 PM Cases called: 21CF651, 21CM342, 22CF98 & 22CF252. Defendant Talvin F. Barrow in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Talvin F. Barrow.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a status conference. The parties have an agreement that involves a Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Parties are looking for a plea hearing.

Parties have stipulated that the bond in 22CF252 can be amended from a $5000 cash bond to a $2000 cash bond. All conditions remain unchanged.

Plea Hearing: 10/28/22 at 10:30am via Zoom. Defendant waives right to a personal appearance at that hearing.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(Cases 21CF651, 21CM342, 22CF98, 22CF252 are called at 10:29 AM)  Defendant Talvin F. Barrow not in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Talvin F. Barrow. Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates the Defendant is at a funeral today out of the area. State does not object to rescheduling cases. 
Status Conference in all cases: 09/09/2022 at 3:00 PM (IN PERSON- set for 1/2 hour)

2:30 PM cases 21CF651, 21CM342, 22CF98, 22CF252 called. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Talvin F. Barrow in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Talvin F. Barrow. There has been a DAGP offer made that the defense would like to discuss further with the assigned DA. A Status Conference is scheduled for 7/21/22 at 10:30 AM (in person, possible plea).

Cases called at 2:29 PM: 22CF98, 22CF252. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Talvin F. Barrow appeared via video.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared via video for Talvin F. Barrow.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared via video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to personal appearance. 22CF98: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
STC: 5/24/22 at 2:30 PM (Br 5).
Status conference on May 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(2:57 PM cases 21CM342, 21CF651, 22CF98, 22CF252 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Talvin F. Barrow appeared by video. Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared by video for Talvin F. Barrow.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant advised of charges and potential penalties for 22CF98.Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF98 and Court accepts waiver.
Defendant waives reading of Information in 22CF252 and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts in both 22CF252 and 22CF98, which the Court accepts.
Attorney Schmidt is to schedule cases 21CM342 and 21CF651 with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.
Status Conference scheduled for cases 22CF98 and 22CF252 on May 13, 2022 at 2:30 pm (1/2 hour) via Zoom.

ADDRESS INFO for Talvin F. Barrow
Current: 257 W 146th Street, Riverdale, IL 60827 United States  (Effective: 03-17-2022)
Prior: 411 S Victory St, Fall Creek, WI 54742
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on March 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Case called at 1:59 PM.
Defendant Talvin F. Barrow appeared in court with Attorney Karl Schmidt. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing.
Branch 3 to schedule ARGN.
Defense filed motion to amend bond down to a $3,000 Cash Bond to allow the Defendant to obtain local housing. State objects (State initially requested $7500 Cash Bond, History of failing to appear, high lethality factors).  Court denies the motion to modify the bond.
Defendant's Request to Review Bond

Conditions:
No contact with Z.M. or her residence.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

State requests $7500 Cash Bond ( 4 open cases, escalating behavior, high lethality factors, disregard for Court orders). Court orders $5000 Cash Bond.
